Live Nation to postpone all tours due to coronavirus

As more concerns arise about the coronavirus, Live Nation is putting a pause on its tours.

(Getty/Cesare Ferrari)

INDIANAPOLIS (WTHR) â€” As more concerns arise about the coronavirus, Live Nation is putting a pause on its tours.

On March 12, the New York Times reported that Live Nation will instruct "its touring shows to prepare to return home." This will affect tours domestically and internationally.

The company is hitting pause on current touring arena shows through the end of the month.

Tours that will be affected include Billie Eilish and Elton John along with many others.

Live Nation is instructing its employees to work remotely,according to Billboard. It plans to re-evaluate the situation at the beginning of April.
